column.name: SERVICE_SUBSCRIPTION_ID
column.comment: The Service Subscription Id is a foreign key to a Service Subscription. The Service Subscription Price Plan Subscription table enables a many to many relationship between Service Subscriptions and Price Plan Subscriptions.

column.name: PRICE_PLAN_SUBSCRIPTION_ID
column.comment: The Price Plan Subscription Id is a foreign key to a Price Plan Subscription. The Service Subscription Price Plan Subscription table enables a many to many relationship between Service Subscriptions and Price Plan Subscriptions.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: The Effective Date is the date for which a particular instance of a Service Subscription Price Plan Subscription row is effective.

column.name: CHANGE_TYPE
column.comment: Audit information capturing user id of last update

column.name: _LOADTM
column.comment: data warehouse entry change date timestamp (Original name in the DWHDB "_LOADTM")

column.name: EFFECTIVE_STATUS
column.comment: The Effective Status defines a row as being ACTIVE or DEACTive on the associated Effective Date.

column.name: ACTIVE_PRICE_PLAN_INDICATOR
column.comment: The Active Price Plan Indicator is used in the Apply New Pricing Structure scenario to determine if the updated Price Plan changes are billable.

column.name: TRANSACTION_ID
column.comment: The Transaction Id is used in the Apply New Pricing Structure scenario to track the changes in the Price Plan, in order to roll back unwanted changes.

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_USER_ID
column.comment: Audit information capturing user id of last update

column.name: AUDIT_UPDATE_DATE_TIME
column.comment: Audit information capturing date and time of last update

column.name: UPDATE_NUMBER
column.comment: Version number of the row. The version number starts with a random number and is incremented on each update. Update and Delete operations verify that the number in the database is equal to the number used in the SQL statement (optimistic locking).

column.name: EFFECTIVE_FLAG
column.comment: Flagging of entries according to EFFECTIVE_DATE maintained by source system (EFFONL). "N" (now) - currently valid entry, "P" (past) - entry that was valid some then in the past, "F" (future) - entity will be valid in the future.
